INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & R 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth's eyeglasses have been broken since November 2022.
Investigation On 1/30/23, I notified Complainant of this investigation assignment via
email on 1/30/23. On 1/31/23, I met her face-to-face at Youth J’s
school. Complainant expressed no additional concerns regarding
Adrian Group Home.
2

On 1/30/23, I notified Youth J’s foster care worker of this investigation
assignment. On 2/6/23, I participated in a conference call arranged by
the Placement Coordination Unit (PCU) with the foster care worker in
attendance.
Youth J was admitted to Adrian Group Home on 7/18/22. I interviewed
Youth J at school on 1/31/23. He was wearing eyeglasses. The right
arm of the frame was broken off. A string from the right side of the
frame to the left arm holds the glasses in place. The nosepiece and
lenses are intact.
Youth J said his foster care worker is aware of the broken frames. He
said he accidently broke them at school, but he could not remember
when he broke them. He got his current pair of glasses with his mother
when he lived with her prior to coming into care. He said he does not
know if or when he has an eye appointment scheduled.
I notified Director of Operations (DO) of the allegation and interviewed
her face-to-face at the facility on 1/31/23. DO said Youth J’s frames
broke in mid-December 2022 and explained, “We’ve been trying to
replace his glasses. Foster Care Worker did not have a prescription so
we could not use that to replace the frames.” Prior to breaking them,
she said Youth J already had an initial eye examination scheduled for
12/27/22 at SVS Vision in Adrian, but SVS Vision rescheduled that
appointment due to flooding in their building. DO said his new
appointment is on 3/4/23.
DO said the facility nurse searched all of the eye doctors for ones who
accepted Medicaid and SVS Vision was the only provider in the area. If
for some reason Youth J is ineligible for an eye examination, lenses,
and frames, I asked DO who would pay for these. DO said if Medicaid
does not pay, Adrian Group Home will.
Analysis Youth J accidentally broke the arm of his eyeglass frames between the
end of November and mid-December 2022. The facility scheduled an
eye appointment for 12/27/22. Due to a flood, the provider cancelled
Youth J’s appointment and rescheduled it for 3/4/23.
CONSULTATION
I emailed Chief Administrator (CA) and asked her to contact SVS Vision
to see if they have a cancellation so Youth J can be seen sooner. CA
responded on 2/2/23 stating they did have a cancellation and can see
Youth J on 2/7/23. I also asked CA to inform Youth J so he knows he
will be getting a new pair of glasses soon.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
